studyInterventions.name: ALXN1840
studyInterventions.description: Oral bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate (formerly WTX101), a copper binding agent for Wilson disease; administered as repeat-dose 15 mg/day with planned titration to 30 mg/day.

studyInterventions.name: Penicillamine
studyInterventions.description: Wilson disease copper-chelating therapy; participants taking it at enrollment must discontinue starting Day -4 to allow baseline copper/molybdenum balance assessment.

studyInterventions.name: Trientine
studyInterventions.description: Wilson disease copper-chelating therapy; participants taking it at enrollment must discontinue starting Day -4 to allow baseline copper/molybdenum balance assessment.

studyInterventions.name: Zinc therapy
studyInterventions.description: Wilson disease therapy affecting intestinal copper absorption; must be discontinued and participants must be off zinc for a minimum of 21 days prior to Day 1.

studyInterventions.name: Acetaminophen (paracetamol)
studyInterventions.description: Permitted concomitant medication with Investigator approval; maximum 1000 mg/day.

studyInterventions.name: Ibuprofen
studyInterventions.description: Permitted concomitant medication with Investigator approval; use with caution; maximum 1200 mg in any 24-hour period.

administrations.name: ALXN1840 15 mg/day (Treatment Period 1)
administrations.dose: 15 mg
administrations.duration: Day 1 through Day 28 (approximately 28 days; minimum 4 weeks planned)

administrations.name: ALXN1840 30 mg/day (after titration)
administrations.dose: 30 mg (administered as 2 × 15 mg tablets)
administrations.duration: Day 29 through Day 39 (approximately 11 days)

administrations.name: ALXN1840 repeat dosing overall
administrations.dose: 15 mg/day or 30 mg/day
administrations.duration: Up to 40 days total dosing per Table 6; participants discontinued from ALXN1840 by their physician at the latest by Day 54 follow-up

administrations.name: ALXN1840 administration conditions (inpatient/CRU)
administrations.duration: While in CRU during dosing periods (inpatient periods)

administrations.name: ALXN1840 administration conditions (outpatient)
administrations.doseFrequency: once daily at approximately the same time (±1 hour)
administrations.duration: During Outpatient Period (Day 9 to Day 23; may be extended up to additional 14 days with Investigator approval)

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose reduction / rechallenge for ALT elevation
administrations.dose: 15 mg every other day (QOD)
administrations.duration: When ALT returns to <2×ULN (if baseline normal) or <2× increase from baseline (if baseline above reference range) after temporary interruption

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose reduction for ALT increase >2× baseline or >2×ULN
administrations.dose: Reduce to previous dose level or to 15 mg every other day if on 15 mg once daily
administrations.doseFrequency: every other day (if reduced to 15 mg QOD)
administrations.duration: Until resolution of abnormality; no further dose increase until resolution

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose modification for anemia (hemoglobin <8 g/dL without bleeding)
administrations.dose: 15 mg every other day (QOD) after interruption
administrations.duration: After temporary interruption; rechallenge when hemoglobin and other hematology parameters return to baseline

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose modification for hemoglobin decrease >30% from baseline
administrations.dose: Reduce to previous dose level or to 15 mg every other day if on 15 mg once daily
administrations.doseFrequency: every other day (if reduced to 15 mg QOD)
administrations.duration: Until resolution of abnormality; no further dose increase until resolution

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose modification for thrombocytopenia (platelets <30,000/µL)
administrations.dose: 15 mg every other day (QOD) after interruption
administrations.duration: After temporary interruption; rechallenge when platelets and other hematology parameters return to baseline

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose modification for platelets decrease >30% from baseline (baseline low)
administrations.dose: Reduce to previous dose level or to 15 mg every other day if on 15 mg once daily
administrations.doseFrequency: every other day (if reduced to 15 mg QOD)
administrations.duration: Until resolution of abnormality; no further dose increase until resolution

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose modification for neutropenia (neutrophils <1.0 × 10^3/µL)
administrations.dose: 15 mg every other day (QOD) after interruption
administrations.duration: After temporary interruption; rechallenge when neutrophils and other hematology parameters return to baseline

administrations.name: Penicillamine discontinuation for baseline assessment
administrations.duration: If taking at enrollment, discontinue starting Day -4 (approximately 4 days prior to initiating ALXN1840 on Day 1)

administrations.name: Trientine discontinuation for baseline assessment
administrations.duration: If taking at enrollment, discontinue starting Day -4 (approximately 4 days prior to initiating ALXN1840 on Day 1)

administrations.name: Zinc therapy washout
administrations.duration: Must be off zinc therapy for a minimum of 21 days prior to Day 1

administrations.name: Acetaminophen (paracetamol) permitted use
administrations.dose: Up to 1000 mg/day
administrations.duration: As needed during study with Investigator approval

administrations.name: Ibuprofen permitted use
administrations.dose: Up to 1200 mg per 24-hour period
administrations.duration: As needed during study with Investigator approval

substances.name: bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate
substances.description: Active substance / drug name for ALXN1840; formerly known as WTX101.

substances.name: tetrathiomolybdate (active anion)
substances.description: Active anion contained in ALXN1840; rapidly binds copper to form tetrathiomolybdate-copper-albumin complex (TPC).

substances.name: tetrathiomolybdic acid
substances.description: Amount specified per tablet: 7.8 mg tetrathiomolybdic acid per 15 mg ALXN1840 tablet.

substances.name: penicillamine
substances.description: Copper-chelating therapy referenced as prior/concomitant WD therapy; discontinued for baseline assessments if used at enrollment.

substances.name: trientine
substances.description: Copper-chelating therapy referenced as prior/concomitant WD therapy; discontinued for baseline assessments if used at enrollment.

substances.name: zinc
substances.description: WD therapy; must be discontinued with minimum 21-day washout before Day 1.

substances.name: acetaminophen
substances.description: Allowed concomitant medication with maximum 1000 mg/day.

substances.name: ibuprofen
substances.description: Allowed concomitant medication with maximum 1200 mg per 24 hours; caution advised due to CYP2C9 substrate considerations.

administrations.name: ALXN1840 15 mg/day (Treatment Period 1)
administrations.dose: 15 mg
administrations.duration: Day 1 through Day 28 (approximately 28 days; minimum 4 weeks planned)

administrations.name: ALXN1840 30 mg/day (after titration)
administrations.dose: 30 mg (administered as 2 × 15 mg tablets)
administrations.duration: Day 29 through Day 39 (approximately 11 days)

administrations.name: ALXN1840 administration conditions (inpatient/CRU)
administrations.duration: While in CRU during dosing periods (inpatient periods)
administrations.additionalInstructions: Administer after overnight fast (≥10 hours) with 240 mL water; delay meals at least 2 hours after dosing.

administrations.name: ALXN1840 administration conditions (outpatient)
administrations.frequency: once daily at approximately the same time (±1 hour)
administrations.duration: During Outpatient Period (Day 9 to Day 23; may be extended up to additional 14 days with Investigator approval)
administrations.additionalInstructions: Take with a glass of water on an empty stomach; delay meals at least 2 hours after dosing; SMS text confirmation of dosing.

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose reduction / rechallenge for ALT elevation
administrations.dose: 15 mg every other day (QOD)
administrations.duration: When ALT returns to <2×ULN (if baseline normal) or <2× increase from baseline (if baseline above reference range) after temporary interruption

administrations.dose: Reduce to previous dose level or to 15 mg every other day if on 15 mg once daily

administrations.duration: Until resolution of abnormality; no further dose increase until resolution

administrations.duration: After temporary interruption; rechallenge when hemoglobin and other hematology parameters return to baseline

administrations.dose: Reduce to previous dose level or to 15 mg every other day if on 15 mg once daily
administrations.frequency: every other day (if reduced to 15 mg QOD)
administrations.duration: Until resolution of abnormality; no further dose increase until resolution

administrations.duration: After temporary interruption; rechallenge when platelets and other hematology parameters return to baseline
